name: sandbox-4
description: Production bugs: 6 interconnected search form control bugs including race conditions, URL history pollution, and broken number inputs (Feb 8, 2026).

event.message: RangeError: Invalid array length - NaN passed to result filter in search form
event.title: RangeError: Invalid array length

issue.title: RangeError: Invalid array length in search form control

data.title: Bug: Number inputs breaking with NaN values
data.description:
## Issue
Number input fields in search form are receiving NaN and causing Invalid array length errors.

## Sentry Reference
- Issue: SEARCH-742
- 42 errors, 8 users affected
- First seen: 14:00 UTC

## Root Cause
`useSearchFilters` hook's `parseNumberInput()` returns NaN when value is empty, not caught before Array constructor.

## Impact
- Search form crashes when user clears number filter
- Affects range filters, counts, numeric parameters

## Fix Required
- Add NaN check before Array(count) calls
- Return 0 or undefined instead of NaN
- Add unit tests for edge cases

data.title: Bug: Race condition in search query debounce
data.description:
## Issue
Multiple simultaneous search queries can execute out of order when user rapidly types, causing inconsistent results.

## Sentry Reference
- Issue: SEARCH-742
- Related to form control timing

## Root Cause
Debounce not tracking request sequence number - older requests can resolve after newer ones.

## Impact
- User sees outdated search results after typing
- Results don't match the query shown in input
- Confusing UX when query is fast-changing

## Fix Required
- Add sequence tracking to debounced queries
- Discard results from older sequence numbers
- Add request ID to abort controller

data.title: Bug: Void operators bypassing filter validation
data.description:
## Issue
Optional chaining and nullish coalescing operators allowing invalid filter states to persist.

## Sentry Reference
- Issue: SEARCH-742
- Related to form state validation

## Root Cause
Filter validation uses `filter?.value ?? 0` without type checking - allows invalid types through.

## Impact
- Filters applied with wrong types (string instead of number)
- Query parsing fails silently
- Search results inconsistent with filter UI state

## Fix Required
- Strengthen type validation in filter parsing
- Add type guards before void operators
- Validate filter state shape before use

data.title: Bug: URL history pollution from duplicate search state
data.description:
## Issue
Every filter change is pushing to browser history, creating duplicate entries and polluting back button behavior.

## Sentry Reference
- Issue: SEARCH-742
- Related to form state synchronization

## Root Cause
`handleFilterChange` calls `router.push()` for every keystroke, not using replaceState for rapid changes.

## Impact
- Browser back button creates 20+ history entries per search
- Users forced to click back many times to exit search
- History stack grows unbounded

## Fix Required
- Use replaceState for sequential updates within debounce window
- Only push new history entry after final query submitted
- Clear intermediate history states

data.title: Bug: Client-side filter state out of sync with server
data.description:
## Issue
Local filter state not synchronized with URL and server state, causing data inconsistencies.

## Sentry Reference
- Issue: SEARCH-742
- Related to form synchronization

## Root Cause
Multiple state sources (React state, URL params, server cache) not reconciled on mount/update.

## Impact
- Filters applied locally not reflected in actual search
- Refreshing page resets filters even though URL has them
- Server returns wrong results for applied filters

## Fix Required
- Normalize filter state on component mount from URL
- Sync React state with URL params bidirectionally
- Add validation of URL params before using them

data.title: Bug: Missing Sentry/Linear resource IDs in error reporting
data.description:
## Issue
Sentry error reports missing resource IDs (workspace_id, query_id) making it hard to trace which user/query triggered the bug.

## Sentry Reference
- Issue: SEARCH-742
- Error events missing context for correlation

## Root Cause
Resource tags not extracted from React context before error is thrown.

## Impact
- Can't correlate errors to specific workspaces
- Difficult to debug user-specific search issues
- Linear issues can't link back to specific Sentry events

## Fix Required
- Extract resource IDs from app context before using them
- Add as tags to Sentry error context
- Pass IDs to error boundary for logging

issue.title: 6 interconnected search form control bugs causing production outages
issue.body:
## Summary
Sentry SEARCH-742 detected 6 interconnected bugs in the search form control affecting number inputs, debouncing, filter state, and URL history.

## Affected Components
- `apps/console/src/components/search-form.tsx`
- `apps/console/src/hooks/useSearchFilters.ts`
- `apps/console/src/lib/search-state.ts`

## Issues
1. **LF-420**: Number inputs break with NaN values
2. **LF-421**: Race condition in debounce timing
3. **LF-422**: Void operators bypassing validation
4. **LF-423**: URL history pollution from duplicate state
5. **LF-424**: Client-side filter sync out of sync with server
6. **LF-425**: Missing Sentry resource IDs

## Impact
- 42 errors from 8 users in first 15 minutes
- Search form crashes when clearing filters
- Inconsistent results when typing quickly
- Browser back button unusable

## Sentry
- SEARCH-742 (RangeError: Invalid array length)

repository.name: lightfast
repository.description: AI agent orchestration platform - neural memory for engineering teams

pull_request.title: fix(console): resolve 6 search form control bugs
pull_request.body:
## Summary
Fixes 6 interconnected search form control bugs: NaN handling, race conditions, filter validation, URL history, state synchronization, and error reporting.

## Changes
1. **Number input handling**: Added NaN check in parseNumberInput, return 0 instead of NaN
2. **Race condition fix**: Added sequence tracking to debounced queries with abort controller
3. **Filter validation**: Added type guards before void operators, strengthen validation
4. **URL history**: Use replaceState for intermediate updates, only push on final submit
5. **State sync**: Normalize filter state from URL on mount, bidirectional sync
6. **Sentry context**: Extract resource IDs from context before using, add as tags

## Testing
- [x] Number inputs no longer crash with cleared values
- [x] Rapid typing shows consistent results
- [x] Back button works normally without duplicate history
- [x] Filters persist across page refreshes
- [x] Error reports include workspace/query IDs

## Related Issues
- Fixes #355
- Fixes LF-420
- Fixes LF-421
- Fixes LF-422
- Fixes LF-423
- Fixes LF-424
- Fixes LF-425
- Resolves Sentry SEARCH-742

issue.title: RangeError: Invalid array length in search form control

data.title: Bug: Number inputs breaking with NaN values
data.description:
## Issue
Number input fields in search form are receiving NaN and causing Invalid array length errors.

## Sentry Reference
- Issue: SEARCH-742
- 107 total errors, 12 users affected
- Duration: 14:00 - 18:15 UTC (~4 hours)

## Resolution
- Root cause: parseNumberInput returning NaN instead of safe default
- Fix: Added NaN check, return 0 instead of NaN
- PR #356 merged and deployed at 18:30 UTC
- Sentry SEARCH-742 resolved via commit 7a914dbd

nodes.title: PR #356: fix(console): resolve 6 search form bugs

data.body:
## Post-Incident Summary

**Timeline:**
- 14:00 - Sentry detected RangeError (SEARCH-742)
- 14:15 - Issue grouped: 42 errors from 8 users
- 14:30 - Created 6 Linear issues (LF-420 through LF-425)
- 14:45 - GitHub issue #355 opened with full analysis
- 18:00 - PR #356 opened with comprehensive fixes
- 18:30 - PR merged, 5 commits to main
- 18:35 - GitHub push event to main (commit 7a914dbd)
- 18:40 - Vercel deployment created
- 18:45 - Vercel deployment succeeded
- 19:00 - Sentry SEARCH-742 resolved, LF-420 marked Done

**Impact:** 107 total errors, 12 users affected, ~4.25 hour incident

**Root Causes Fixed:**
1. NaN in number inputs  return safe defaults
2. Race condition in debounce  sequence tracking with abort controller
3. Void operators  added type guards and validation
4. URL history pollution  replaceState for intermediate updates
5. Client-server state sync  normalized from URL on mount
6. Missing resource IDs  extracted from context before use

**Key Learnings:**
- Form state needs centralized synchronization source
- Type safety important for optional chaining patterns
- URL represents source of truth for bookmarkability
- Browser history API needs careful sequencing
